oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Potential for Milk Residues and Pharmacokinetic Values of Ketoprofen Following a Single Intravenous Bolus Injection in Lactating Dairy Goats
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Musser, Jeffrey M. B.
Anderson, Kevin L.
Tyckowska, Krystyne L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ketoprofen
NSAID
inflammatory condition
milk
lactating goat
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ketoprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug which may be beneficial in the treatment of inflammatory conditions in ruminants. This study was to determine pharmacokinetic parameters and whether or not ketoprofen achieved measurable levels in milk following a single intravenous bolus injection in lactating goats.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1996; 191-192
